quote: Captain's log, stardate 44307.3.   I am preparing to leave by   shuttlecraft for Pentarus Five,   where I have been asked to mediate   a dispute among the salenite   miners -- a contentious group   unfortunately prone to violence.
At the same time, I must deal with   a situation of a far more personal   nature.
Ensign, I summoned you almost ten   minutes ago!
Yes, sir, I know, but I was in   the middle of an experiment using   some volatile compounds and I   couldn't just leave them lying   out --
Excuses, Mister Crusher?
No, sir, not at all, it was more   of an explanation --
Because I assure you that will   not go over well at Starfleet   Academy.
I know, sir, but --
The Academy?
I just got the message from   Admiral Nsomeka. She expects   you to report in two weeks.
A position has opened up in this   year's class. You'll have to work   overtime to catch up, but I have   assured the Commander that you   will be capable of that. Please   don't make a liar of me.
Oh, yes sir! I mean -- no, sir.
And as your final mission aboard   the Enterprise... I'd like you   to accompany me to Pentarus while   I try to sort things out with the   miners.
Yes, sir...
Mister Riker tells me you've been   studying the effects of outpost   judiciary decisions on Federation   Law. What better way to get   first-hand experience?
Captain, I am picking up a general   distress signal from Gamelan Five.
On screen.
Please... Does anyone read us?
Open channel.       I am Captain Jean-Luc Picard of   the Federation Starship   Enterprise.

Captain... I am Chairman Songi,   of Gamelan Four. An unidentified   spacecraft has entered orbit above   our planet. Radiation levels in   our atmosphere have increased by   three thousand percent. We can   only assume we are under attack   -- but the ship will not answer   our hails! We are a peaceful   planet... we have no ability to   defend ourselves. Please, can   you help us?
Mister Data, are we close enough   for a scan?
Nossir, we are out of range.
Any other ships near that system?
Negative, Commander.
Very well. Chairman Songi, we   will proceed immediately to your   planet.
Thank you, Captain Picard...
Mister Riker, take the Enterprise   and investigate the problem.   Ensign Crusher and I will proceed   to Pentarus Five.       The miners have sent a shuttle.   We'll depart in ten minutes.
Your maneuvering thrusters are   rigged in a configuration I   haven't seen before.
My own modification. It's more   efficient. You can study it if   you want...
I've run operational and safety   inspections, Captain. It checks   out. I won't make any claims for   comfort.
Captain Picard... Captain Dirgo,   of the shuttlecraft "Nenebek".
Ah -- Captain. Good to meet you.
"Captain?" Of a mining shuttle?
Yes, Ensign -- Captain. My ship   isn't pretty, and she isn't big   -- but we've logged almost ten   thousand hours together.
It seems a very -- sturdy --   craft.
We should go. Will you take Ops,   Captain?
I'll let Ensign Crusher perform   that task. I need to study up   on Regalian law.
Crusher to Bridge...
Go ahead, Mister Crusher.
Shuttlecraft Nenebek prepared   for departure.
Acknowledged, Ensign. Begin   launch sequence.
Launch sequence confirmed...
Shuttlecraft has cleared the bay.
Ensign Allenby, set a course for   the Gamelan system... Warp Six.
Aye, Sir.
You've done this before.
Yes...
(jerking his head toward     the cabin)   If your Captain isn't tougher than   he looks, those miners will tear   him apart.
Don't worry about Captain Picard   -- he'll handle them.
I've lost navigation --
The port thruster quad is gone,   guidance coupling is severed --   I can't stabilize her!
The port thruster module blew...
Nenebek to Enterprise...   emergency... do you read?   Pentarus station... come in...       Communication is gone --
Is your navigational system   functioning?
Negative. Switching to manual.
Estimated position... ?
Fifty million kilometers from   Pentarus Five... we may have to   put down somewhere else...
Mister Crusher, scan for a class   M environment...
Aye, sir.
We'll lose the main impulse engine   if I don't throttle it down.
One of the moons of Pentarus   Three... it's class M -- barely   -- mean temperature fifty-five   degrees Celsius...
Life forms indicated?
Negative. But sensors are   limited. There's an intense   magnetic field near the surface.
We don't have a choice.
Save the impulse engine for a   controlled entry.
Ensign, reconfigure the working   thrusters to manual inputs.
I'll try, sir -- but this grid   looks about a hundred years old...
I don't have the Federation's   resources...       Captain... will you take the helm?
I'm rerouting the deuterium   flow --
We'll have to manually trip the   bypass from the main engine to   the thrusters...
Where'd you learn that?
We've got power reconfigured,   Captain.
Hull temperature seven hundred   degrees --
Beginning braking maneuver.
We're below Mach One! Bypass   to thrusters now!
Let's salvage what we can.       The first thing we'll need is   shelter from the sun. In this   heat, the shuttle will act like   an oven.
All systems are out. Can't get   a communication channel. Location   transponder's gone, too.
We'll have to check the craft for   something to protect our heads   and eyes... and Captain, please   recover your medical supplies...   food and water rations...
The medical supplies are all   right...
But... food and water?
A replicator... damaged beyond   repair.
Surely... you have emergency   supplies.
This isn't a starship! I have   to choose what I carry!
Are you telling me... that we have   no water?
Scanning. Vessel reads as an   unmanned sublight freighter.
Origin?
Indeterminate. Propulsion appears   to employ a gaseous-core fission   reactor, but it is not functioning.
The radiation levels coming from   that ship are off the scale.
Mister Data, could that be   leakage from their engines?
No sir. Engine reactor elements   appear to have been inactive for   approximately three hundred years.   The vessel is carrying various   unstable waste products.
You mean... it's a garbage scow.
Precisely.
Mister Worf, open a hailing   frequency.       Chairman Songi, this is Commander   Riker on board the Enterprise.
Yes, Commander.
It appears you've inherited   someone else's problem... It's   an old waste vessel... caught by   your planet's gravitational pull.
Have your people begun to suffer   from radiation sickness?
Not yet. But some areas are   already detecting dangerous   levels.
We'll do our best to get it out   of here as quickly as possible.
Thank you, Commander.
We're going to give that barge   a push into the Gamelan sun.
Sir, the Meltasion Asteroid Belt   lies between here and the sun.
Then we'll have to take it   ourselves and have our   deflectors clear a safe path   through the asteroids.
I don't like the idea of getting   close enough to that barge to tow   it. The radiation levels are so   high we'd be risking contamination   of the entire crew.
Got a better idea, Geordi?
We could send over a construction   module to attach thrusters to it.   Then we could direct it through   the asteroid belt from a safe   distance.
Commander... a message from the   mining settlement on Pentarus.   The shuttle carrying Captain   Picard has not yet arrived.
They left here at oh-eight-hundred   hours...
They have asked if we will be   starting a search.
Tell them we have an emergency   situation here... we'll start a   search after we've dealt with it.
Aye, sir.
Mister La Forge, prepare to launch   the construction module. Let's   get this over with as fast as we   can.
Mister Crusher, any luck with that   tricorder?
I think so, sir. The scanning   range may be limited, but it's   better than nothing.
These were on board, Captain.   They're working.

Excellent. Now --       Our communicators may not be able   to get a signal through this   strong a magnetic field... so I've   fashioned an arrow. If a search   party finds the wreckage, they'll   know we've headed for those   mountains.
Are you crazy?
It's too far away. We'll never   make it.
We can't survive out here in the   sun.
Where there are mountains, there   is shelter.
You have no right to make the   decisions! I'm Captain of this   ship!
If you want to get out of this,   I suggest you listen. Captain   Picard is the one who's going to   keep us alive --
Thank you, Ensign, that's enough.
Yes, sir.
Captain Dirgo, you're an able   pilot and I welcome your input.   Do you feel there's an alternative   we're overlooking?
No.

Very well. I suggest a steady   pace, but not a brisk one. We   need to ration our energy. Try   to breathe through your nose, it   will help prevent dehydration.   I'll lead... Captain Dirgo, will   you bring up the rear?
And you were worried about how   tough the Captain is?
Did you find water?
No... not yet...
What are you doing with that?
Mister Crusher?
I'm not sure, sir... an energy   reading.
Energy reading? What kind?
Low frequency E-M. It's been   getting stronger... the closer   we get to those mountains.
What are you saying? There's   something over there? Waiting   for us?
I don't know what it is. It just   registers as a repeating energy   pattern...
Ensign, are you suggesting this   energy is not naturally occurring?
The readings could be indicating   some electromagnetic property in   the rocks... but I don't think so.
A life form?
It's possible... the pattern's   fairly organized...
We can't go back... and we can't   stay here. We have to keep going   to the mountains. No matter   what's waiting there.
There has to be water in here...   aren't caves formed by water?
Not necessarily... they could   have been created by volcanic   activity -- lava flows.       These walls are dry... Mister   Crusher, do you get any moisture   reading?
No, sir... But that E-M reading?   The pattern has changed... and   the frequency is peaking a lot   higher...
You have water!
I wouldn't hide water...
It's called dresci... from my   planet.
Alcohol.
It's -- medicinal. For   emergencies.
I was going to share it with   you...
This won't quench your thirst...   it will only make it worse.
I'll take my chances...
I'm not going to let you waste   this. It's more valuable to us   as a coolant or a disinfectant.
It's mine!
Mister Crusher, stow this with   the medical supplies and keep your   eye on it.
Yes, sir.
Now we're going to explore this   cave. Mister Crusher, look for   any indication of water, no matter   how faint. Captain Dirgo -- will   you lead the way?
We're projecting that the bulk   of the radiation will affect three   small island groups.

Fortunately, they're sparsely   populated. We'll start   replicating hyronalin now and be   ready to transport it to them if   it becomes necessary. Please   coordinate with the medical   personnel on the planet.
We've contacted the nearest   Starbase for a search vessel...   I'm afraid the closest one is   almost a week away...
I see. Thank you.
But we have asked the mining   settlement to send out any vessels   they might have.
You know, there are many reasons   why the shuttle might have been   delayed...
Deanna -- thank you. But I'm all   right. And for now, I have work   to do.
Commander... the miners report   that they have very few operable   shuttle craft. They want to know   when we will be joining the   search.
Tell them to stand by. If this   works, we'll be on our way.
Thrusters are attached and ready,   Commander.
Initiate prefire sequence.
Prefire command transmitted.   Thrusters to standby.
Fire thrusters... gradual   acceleration to forty percent   power.
We've lost one module. Correcting   thrust vectors to compensate.
Structural integrity of the barge   has been compromised.   Disintegration is continuing.
Shut down thrusters! Ensign, take   us one thousand meters ahead of   the barge and hold.
External radiation levels are   increasing.
Coming into position at one   thousand meters.
Mister Worf, extend shields around   the ship and lock on a tractor   beam.
Aye, sir.
Warning. Radiation levels at   seventy millirads per minute and   rising.
Allenby, set a new course. We're   going to take it through the   asteroid belt ourselves. One-quarter   impulse.
Aye, sir.
Doctor Crusher to the Bridge.
On my way.
Data... I need a projection of   the radiation impact on the   crew... Worf...       ... signal the mining settlement.   Tell them -- we won't be joining   the search for awhile.
There's light up ahead!
Captain... water!
I knew there had to be water!
Mister Crusher... what was that?
It seems to be some kind of   tightly confined annular force   field...
Put there to protect the water.
Then there has to be a way to   de-activate it...
We can with our phasers.
I think it might be wiser if...
The E-M pattern again -- the   power level's really spiking   now...
Look... I think it's working!
Dirgo...
Stop firing!
Help me!
Dirgo -- move!
Keep pressure on that wound!
This is the worst break... ?
What was that thing... ?
Keep the pressure constant.
Ensign... how bad is it?
You have a broken leg... Your   left arm is... I think there's   a fracture there, too. And you   took a bad blow to the head. But   we're getting the bleeding under   control.
Good work... I'm going to be fine   in a moment... just need to catch   my breath...
Tell him the truth.
What truth?
(removing his hand from     the wound)   He's bleeding inside. I've seen   it before. He'll never survive.
You don't know what you're talking   about.
You're wasting your time. Save   the dresci for us.
Mister Dirgo -- I'd appreciate   it if you didn't bury me before   I'm gone.
The trouble is... he may be right.
No, he's not -- you're going to   be fine...
Captain... ?
For a moment... I saw your   father's face in yours...
He wouldn't give up, either... even   when things looked bleakest, even   on that terrible afternoon...
Strange, I always remember it as   night. Maybe... sudden,   unnecessary death ought to happen   at night... not on a bright   cloudless afternoon...
Wesley... you're going to have   to keep a rein on Dirgo... he's   willful, stubborn... that could   be dangerous...
You'll handle him, sir.
Listen to me. I have no feeling   in my right leg. My vision is   blurred... I'm going to get worse,   not better. I won't be able to   help you, Wesley. You'll have   to stand up to him on your own.
Yes, sir.
Good man...

First Officer's log, stardate   44307.6. Radiation levels on the   Enterprise continue to rise. The   ventilation system has started   pumping hyronalin into our air   supply to counteract the effects.
At the rate the radiation levels   are increasing, the hyronalin   additive will only be effective   for another thirty-eight minutes.
Crusher to Medical Unit One.   Evacuate and seal off all   non-operational areas. Group the   crew and families in the interior   corridors of decks nine and ten,   radiation exposure protocol.
Acknowledged, Doctor
Data... at our current speed, how   long will it take us to get   through the asteroid belt?
Fifty-one minutes, fourteen   seconds.
We're going to have a lot of   casualties if we can't get there   any faster.
Geordi, how much more can the   tractor beam take?
We're already at the upper limit   for towing speed, Commander.
Then let's see if we can establish   a new upper limit...
Aye, sir...
Data, monitor the shearing effect   on the beam... increasing to   one-half impulse.
Tractor beam is holding...   shearing force eighty metric tons   per meter...
Increasing to three-quarters   impulse.
Shearing force ninety-two metric   tons... ninety-three... tractor   beam is destabilizing... we are   going to lose the barge,   Commander...
Reduce power.
One-half impulse.
Geordi, you gotta stabilize the   tractor beam...

I can't divert any more power   to the shields... we're already   hitting maximum thermal limits...       Only other choice is to bring   some other fusion reactors on   line... but we're running at   peak coolant pressure...
Do it.
Warning. Radiation levels at one   hundred fifty millirads per   minute and rising. Lethal   exposure in thirty-five minutes.
Look at that.
How did this happen?
That -- thing -- did it.
Selenium fibers... electrically   deposited.

The E-M pattern is back down...   it only surged when we tried to   get to the water...    (moves back toward     Dirgo)   Whatever it was we saw... it   almost acts like a sentry. To   guard the fountain.       As long as we aren't moving toward   the water, the wave pattern stays   low... right between five and   fifteen hertz... Dirgo, walk   toward the fountain.
That's it! The frequency went   to forty.
What is this getting us? We've   got to get to the water!

If I could find a way to   manipulate the frequency, I might   be able to control it.       The Sentry appeared when we   started using phasers. Maybe it   responds to heat... or to   collinated energy...
If you're right... we can use a   phaser to lure it away.
Hold on... we need to figure out   what it is, before we start doing   anything to it.
Enough talk. Enough thinking.   It's time to do something.
I'll start firing. When it comes   -- you fire and draw it off.
No, we can't...
Then set your phaser on automatic   and take cover.
And how do you know it'll go for   my phaser, not yours?
Because... I'll fire mine on the   lowest setting. You use maximum.
There's no evidence that it   responds differently to higher   settings... we have to figure   out our options before we --
And while we're doing that, your   Captain is dying.    (jerks his head toward     the cave)   With those wounds, most men would   already be dead. If he doesn't   get water...
When I start firing -- you better   do your part.

First Officer's log, supplemental.   Mister La Forge has diverted   power from auxiliary fusion   generators in an attempt to   stabilize the tractor beam. This   is the only hope of increasing   our towing speed so we can clear   the asteroid belt before radiation   levels become fatal.
Warning. Radiation levels at   three hundred millirads per   minute and rising. Lethal   exposure in one minute.
Ready, Commander. I'll be   rotating the output of the   auxiliary reactors, but it should   still give us the power we need.
Proceed, Mister La Forge.
Increasing to three-quarters   impulse.
Shearing force at one hundred   three metric tons... the tractor   beam is stable...
Full impulse.
Tractor beam is holding.
Warning. Lethal radiation   exposure in thirty seconds.
We are in visual range of the   asteroid belt.
On screen.
Warning. Lethal radiation   exposure in fifteen seconds.
Stand by to cut the barge loose...
Warning. Lethal radiation   exposure in ten seconds.
We have cleared the asteroids,   sir.
Let it go.
Radiation intensity is decreasing,   Commander.
Cancel red alert.
Mister Worf, contact the mining   settlement. Tell them we are   joining the search for Captain   Picard.       Ensign, set a new course. Warp   nine.
Cold...
When the sun went down, the   temperature really dropped.       This should help.
... don't seem to be much good   to you, Wesley...
Sir... Dirgo is dead.
I should've tried harder to stop   him...
Sir?
Captain?       Captain Picard!
Sir... please... stay with me...
I'm... trying...
Captain? Remember when we took   the shuttlecraft to Starbase   Five-One-Five? I was dreading   it... six hours alone with you...
But it didn't turn out the way   I thought it would... you kind   of -- opened up to me. I got to   know you.       Sort of.
... it's my fault you're here...   I shouldn't have asked you...
I was honored you wanted me   along...
... I was selfish... knew I might   not see you again... forgive me...
Sir... the past three years...   I've lived more than most people   do in a lifetime...
I think I've been pretty lucky...   no matter what happens. How many   people get to serve with -- with   Jean-Luc Picard?

You don't know this... nobody   knows this, because I never told   anybody... but a lot of what   I've worked for... school, and   science projects, and getting into   the Academy... I've done it   because... because...
Because I wanted you to be proud   of me.
One thing I learned from you...   is that you never quit. And I'm   not quitting now. I've seen you   think yourself out of worse   problems... and I'm going to   think us out of this one.
You're not going to die... I won't   let you die. I'll get to the   water and I'll keep you alive   until they find us. I promise   you.
Are you certain?
It is definitely debris. The   primary material is duranium, with   smaller proportions of sonodanite   and ermanium.
Most shuttlecraft hulls are made   of duranium.
Then, they're gone.
Not necessarily, Doctor. There   is far too little debris to   account for an entire   shuttlecraft.
So what is it?
Dirgo had his maneuvering   thrusters rigged in a funny way...   he claimed it was more efficient.   If one of them blew... it might   have left debris like that.
If only one of his thrusters were   out... he could still have put   down somewhere.
The only Class M planets in the   system are Pentarus Two and   Five... both have been   thoroughly searched by the miners.
Then, we'll search them again.
Sir... there are also four moons   in the Pentarus system that might   support life...
Have the miners searched them?
Not yet, sir.
What's the closest one to the   debris coordinates?
Lambda Paz, one of the moons of   Pentarus Three.
Set a course, Ensign.
Ensign... where are we?
We crashed, sir... we're in a   cave...
... need water...
We -- we don't have any water.   Don't you remember? We tried to   get to the fountain... and Captain   Dirgo...
Yes... I remember...
But I think I'm on to something.   I've analyzed the sentry's   electrical patterns.
Wesley... I may not make it...
I'm going to get to the water...   I took the transponder element   from my communicator... used it   to modify the tricorder...
I think I can use it to interrupt   the sentry's energy pattern...   stop it.       Or at least slow it down...
Listen to me...
Yes, sir?

So much I've wanted to tell you.       At the Academy, there is   someone... who meant a great deal   to me... he has been there   "forever"... you must get to know   him... his name is Boothby... tell   him we were friends...
When I was there... he helped   me... Listen to him...
What does he teach?
He's the groundskeeper. One of   the wisest men I ever knew...       I envy you, Wesley... it is just   the beginning of the adventure   for you.
Go on, get the water, stay   alive... they'll find you.
I'll be back soon.
Wesley...
Always remember... I was... proud   of you...
It worked... !
Captain Picard? Wake up...
There is an intense magnetic   field, Commander. I am getting   an anomalous reading... but it   is not strong enough to interpret   accurately.
I can narrow the frequency range   on the sensor array... and try   to enhance the signal...       Any better, Data?
Yes. The reflection signature   now clearly indicates that it is   metal... duranium. The probablity   is quite high that it is the   shuttlecraft.
Any life signs?
It is impossible to determine.   The magnetic flux would mask any   bio-energy emanations.
Mister Worf, will that   interference affect the   Transporter Beam?
Yes, Commander. An Away Team   would have to take a   shuttlecraft.
Assemble your team, Mister Data.
I'm going with you.
Of course. Lieutenant Worf?
Wesley?
Mom!
Oh, Wesley... thank God...
I'm sure glad to see you...
How did you find us?
We found the wreckage -- and the   arrow which indicated your   direction.
We'll take Wesley by stretcher,   too.
I can walk.
Beverly...
We're on our way back to the   Enterprise, Captain... we've   stabilized your vital signs.
Mister Crusher...
A moment...
I want you all to know...
He saved my life...
Wesley, know this... you will be   missed.
